abstract: Verizon Wireless will allow any device and any application to run on its network next year. This will help increase volume and strengthen its hand in bidding for more bandwidth.
snippet: Verizon Wireless will allow any device and any application to run on its network next year. This will help increase volume and strengthen its hand in bidding for more bandwidth.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Wireless has stunned the wireless world by announcing that by sometime next year it will open its network to “any apps, any device.”

headline.main: Verizon Wireless Says ‘Bring Your Own’ Device

abstract: As AOL learned with its failed attempt to offer broadband service, open access to networks doesn’t help if the price is too high and the terms too tough.
snippet: As AOL learned with its failed attempt to offer broadband service, open access to networks doesn’t help if the price is too high and the terms too tough.
lead_paragraph: Verizon Wireless has said it will open its network to any device and any application. But it hasn’t said on what price and on what terms. These are, of course, crucial to understanding how much effect this move will have.

headline.main: The Other Half of Open: Competition
